postsData.name:
Walter Crosby
Walter Crosby
postsData.content:
When they tell you to STOP spending money.

In an episode of the Sales & Cigars podcast, Dave from Spartan Digital shared something fascinating: his proudest moment is when clients ask to turn OFF their ads because they're at capacity.

After decades in sales, this resonates hard. Because real growth isn't about:

• Maxing out ad spend
•Chasing vanity metrics
• Empty statistics

It's about sustainable, manageable growth that your business can actually handle.

 When was the last time your agency suggested spending LESS?
postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely agree! True growth means knowing when to pull back and focus on quality over quantity. Sustainable success is the goal! 🌱

postsData.name:
Michael Walker Ed.D.
Michael Walker Ed.D.
postsData.content:
️ 𝗜𝘀 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝘁𝗲𝗮𝗺’𝘀 𝗱𝗲𝗰𝗶𝘀𝗶𝗼𝗻-𝗺𝗮𝗸𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘀𝗶𝗹𝗼𝗲𝗱?
️ 𝗔𝗿𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗰𝗮𝘂𝗴𝗵𝘁 𝗶𝗻 𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗹𝘆𝘀𝗶𝘀 𝗽𝗮𝗿𝗮𝗹𝘆𝘀𝗶𝘀, 𝗱𝗲𝗹𝗮𝘆𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗴𝗿𝗲𝘀𝘀?
️ 𝗗𝗼𝗲𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗽𝗿𝗲𝘀𝘀𝘂𝗿𝗲 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗽𝗮𝗰𝗲 𝗺𝗮𝗸𝗲 𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗲𝗴𝗶𝗰 𝗱𝗲𝗰𝗶𝘀𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 𝗼𝘃𝗲𝗿𝗹𝘆 𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗳𝘂𝗹?

 Life teaches us how to make decisions as individuals—but 𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗱𝗲𝗰𝗶𝘀𝗶𝗼𝗻-𝗺𝗮𝗸𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗶𝗻 𝗮 𝘁𝗲𝗮𝗺 𝗿𝗲𝗾𝘂𝗶𝗿𝗲𝘀 𝗮 𝗱𝗶𝗳𝗳𝗲𝗿𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝘀𝗸𝗶𝗹𝗹 𝘀𝗲𝘁. Both can be developed.

𝗗𝗲𝗰𝗶𝘀𝗶𝗼𝗻-𝗺𝗮𝗸𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗶𝘀 𝗮 𝘀𝗸𝗶𝗹𝗹. And like any skill, it can be refined, optimized, and improved.

And it can enhance 𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘆 𝗲𝗹𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗼𝗳 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗱𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗵𝗶𝗽 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗼𝗿𝗴𝗮𝗻𝗶𝘇𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻.

In high-stakes environments, 𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗱𝗲𝗿𝘀 𝗿𝗲𝗹𝘆 𝗼𝗻 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝘃𝗲𝗻 𝗳𝗿𝗮𝗺𝗲𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀 𝘁𝗼:

 𝗠𝗮𝗸𝗲 𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗵-𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗮𝗰𝘁 𝗱𝗲𝗰𝗶𝘀𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗳𝗶𝗱𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲
 𝗔𝗹𝗶𝗴𝗻 𝘁𝗲𝗮𝗺𝘀 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗳𝗮𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗿, 𝗺𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝗽𝗿𝗲𝗰𝗶𝘀𝗲 𝗲𝘅𝗲𝗰𝘂𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻
 𝗥𝗲𝗱𝘂𝗰𝗲 𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝘀𝗲𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗱-𝗴𝘂𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗶𝗻𝗴

That’s exactly what we’ll cover in my LIVE virtual workshop on Feb. 19th at 1:00 pm ET.

"𝗙𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗦𝘁𝗿𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗦𝘁𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗲𝗴𝘆: 𝗗𝗲𝗰𝗶𝘀𝗶𝗼𝗻-𝗠𝗮𝗸𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗧𝗿𝗮𝗻𝘀𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝗮𝗹 𝗟𝗲𝗮𝗱𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗵𝗶𝗽"

𝗬𝗼𝘂’𝗹𝗹 𝘄𝗮𝗹𝗸 𝗮𝘄𝗮𝘆 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵:
 A clear understanding of your decision-making tendencies
 Tools to align your team and eliminate silos
 Custom decision-making frameworks tailored to your challenges and culture.

 𝗜𝗳 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝘄𝗮𝗻𝘁 𝘁𝗼 𝗺𝗮𝗸𝗲 𝗯𝗲𝘁𝘁𝗲𝗿, 𝗳𝗮𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗿, 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗺𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗲𝗴𝗶𝗰 𝗱𝗲𝗰𝗶𝘀𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀, 𝗿𝗲𝗴𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗻𝗼𝘄:

postsData.name:
Anil Kaul
Anil Kaul
postsData.content:
There is an ongoing debate in the Real Estate Industry whether home sellers should provide information about how many days a home has been on market - Days on Market (DOM). There is a pretty big group of brokerages and agents that would like to hide this information. Thanksfor speaking boldly about this topic.
Here is my andperspective on this important issue.

This is a perfect example of why home buyers often feel like they’re navigating a system that isn’t designed for them. Transparency, trust, and fair dealing are buzzwords in every real estate industry conference but too often, actions tell a different story.
As a home buyer, Days on Market matters. It provides critical insights into a property’s demand and market perception. If a home has been on the market longer than average, it doesn’t automatically mean there’s a problem but it does mean I should do my due diligence. Is it priced too high? Does it have condition issues? Or is it simply a hidden gem that others have overlooked? This is exactly the type of information that empowers buyers to make informed decisions.
I believe buyers deserve full transparency—not just selectively disclosed facts that serve the seller’s interests. DOM isn’t just a number; it’s part of the bigger picture that helps buyers make the right offer at the right price. Trying to manipulate or obscure this information erodes trust and ultimately hurts the integrity of the market.
If the industry truly wants to evolve, we need to stop protecting outdated practices and start empowering buyers with the information they need.

comments.commentText: Transparency in real estate transactions is crucial for building trust and empowering buyers.

postsData.commentAdded: Well said! Transparency is key for empowering buyers and building trust. Lets prioritize informed decision-making in real estate! 🏡🔑

postsData.name:
Marie Y.
Marie Y.
postsData.content:
The Benefits of Traveling Abroad: Why You Should Step Outside Your Comfort Zone


In today’s fast-paced, interconnected world, it's easy to fall into the rhythm of daily life and overlook the transformative power of travel. But venturing abroad, even just once in a while, can offer incredible benefits—not just for your personal growth, but also for your career. Here’s why:

1. Broaden Your Perspective
Travel exposes you to different cultures, languages, and ways of thinking. By stepping into new environments, you develop a broader, more inclusive view of the world—something that can foster creativity and innovation in your professional life.

2. Enhance Problem-Solving Skills
When you’re navigating foreign cities, whether it’s figuring out transportation, overcoming language barriers, or adapting to unfamiliar customs, you sharpen your ability to think on your feet. These enhanced problem-solving skills are invaluable in the workplace.

3. Strengthen Emotional Intelligence
Travel requires empathy and patience, as you learn to understand and respect diverse perspectives. This emotional intelligence can boost your ability to collaborate and connect with colleagues from different backgrounds.

4. Recharge and Prevent Burnout
Constant work can leave you mentally exhausted, but a change of scenery—especially in a new country—can provide the mental reset you need. It’s not just about sightseeing; it’s about rejuvenating yourself, so you return to work with a fresh outlook and renewed energy.

5. Expand Your Professional Network
Travel allows you to meet people from around the world, creating potential for new business opportunities or collaborations. These global connections can open doors you never expected.

In the end, travel isn’t just about seeing new places; it’s about seeing the world in a new way. So, the next time the opportunity arises, don’t hesitate to step outside your comfort zone. The experiences and growth you gain will be worth it. ️

comments.commentText: Meeting people from all over the world adds so much value to life and work.

postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely! Traveling not only enriches our personal lives but also fuels professional growth. Its a powerful way to broaden our horizons! 🌍✈️

postsData.name:
Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Data Science & Robotics
Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Data Science & Robotics
postsData.content:
Comparing the All-New AI Models: ChatGPT vs Qwen vs DeepSeek

1. Overview of Each Model
ChatGPT-03 Mini is a lightweight GPT-4-based AI designed for general-purpose tasks. Qwen 2.5 Max excels in multilingual AI applications with enterprise support. DeepSeek V3 focuses on technical reasoning, coding, and AI-powered research.

2. Key Features
ChatGPT-03 Mini is optimized for fast responses and API integration. Qwen 2.5 Max provides strong NLP capabilities and cloud integration. DeepSeek V3 excels in logical reasoning and retrieval-augmented research.

3. Performance Comparison
ChatGPT delivers high conversational accuracy with real-time responses. Qwen balances accuracy with multilingual capabilities. DeepSeek is optimized for technical reasoning and problem-solving.

4. Use Case Examples
ChatGPT automates customer interactions and generates marketing content. Qwen enhances business AI and multilingual chatbots. DeepSeek supports coding, debugging, and research-based AI tasks.

5. Choosing the Right Model
ChatGPT is ideal for content creation and chatbots. Qwen suits businesses needing multilingual AI. DeepSeek is best for developers and researchers tackling complex problem-solving.

[Explore more in the post]

comments.commentText: Are they better than their paid model if you have tested please tell me
Very helpful

postsData.commentAdded: Great insights on AI models! Its fascinating to see how each one excels in its niche. Excited to see future developments in this space!

postsData.name:
Michael Kainatsky
Michael Kainatsky
postsData.content:
Finally, I fixed the most annoying LinkedIn problem!


Today is my birthday, and thankfully, I didn't wake up to 500 "Happy Birthday" messages in my inbox.

You'd think maybe most people would be delighted to get them?

Absolutely not!

This feature, which allows absolute strangers that

-> ignored all your DMs the last year
-> never engaged with any of your content
-> have never spoken with you
-> will never speak with you, until next year

To click a single button without any intent and fill your inbox with
an obligation to respond.

For 19 years, I spent hours throughout this day just typing "thank you
I appreciate it."

It was maddening and only got worse, especially as my network grew larger.

So this year, I fixed the glitch!

I removed my birthday information from my profile.

What an incredible feeling to wake up to no DMs from strangers.

I strongly recommend you do this immediately before it's too late!

And I am sorry to report, we will have 6 more weeks of winter.

Yours truthfully,

comments.commentText: how delightful, bed bath and beyond wished me a happy birthday with a 15% coupon that I Literally get in the mail every week.
Michael Kainatsky
HB, Michael Kainatsky! Yes! I never added it just for that!

postsData.commentAdded: Happy Birthday! 🎉 Great move on removing your birthday info—less clutter and more meaningful connections. Cheers to a stress-free day!

postsData.name:
Roki Hasan
Roki Hasan
postsData.content:
Most entrepreneurs work 60+ hours a week.

But the most successful don’t just work more. They work smarter.

If you build your lead generation system now, you’ll start seeing results faster, and create a machine that works even when you don’t.

Here’s how to start:

1. Write one high-impact email sequence this week. Personalized emails can hit 50% open rates when done right (HubSpot).

2. Spend 1 hour daily connecting with decision-makers. It’s not just a platform, it’s where business happens.

3. Block 2 hours weekly to measure results and refine your strategy. Small tweaks now save hours later.

 The average B2B sales cycle takes 4-6 months. Every lead you nurture today is a potential client tomorrow. The sooner you start, the sooner you scale.

Want to work smarter, not just harder? Take action now and build momentum.

comments.commentText: How do you handle prospects who respond negatively to multiple follow-ups? We’re working on refining our tone.
The long hours are worth it when you’re building something meaningful.

postsData.commentAdded: Great insights! Prioritizing smart strategies over sheer hours is key. Excited to implement these tips for better lead generation! 🚀

Karishma Mehta
Karishma Mehta
postsData.content:
Every time I sit down with someone who’s mastered their craft, I walk away with something that changes the way I look at life. And lately, I’ve been thinking a lot about how we take care of ourselves—what we eat, how we treat our skin, the way we shape our mindset. ️‍

When I spoke to, he broke down the foods we think are healthy but actually aren’t. It made me question how we sometimes blindly trust labels instead of really understanding what goes into our bodies. 

My conversation withmade me realise that skincare can actually be so simple. Just 5 minutes of facial massage a day — no fancy treatments, no 10-step routines—just a little consistency. 

And with, we went deep into manifestation. The power of your thoughts, the words you use, the way you believe in the life you want—it all adds up. She made me realize that the way we think shapes the world we live in. 

At the end of the day, we all just want to feel good—in our bodies, our skin, and our minds. And the best part? We already have everything we need to make that happen.

What’s one thing you’ve changed about your self-care routine recently? Let me know—I’m always looking to learn.

postsData.name:
Milda Bayer
Milda Bayer
postsData.content:
The most important thing when leading an organization is ⬇️

KNOWING YOUR END STATE. 



Scaling fast, Profitability, M&A, IPO - you name it.

Then - reverse engineer it by asking yourself/your leaders - what steps do I/we need to take to get there.

That’s strategy. And then remember - Operational excellence = operational intensity. Be up front with your teams about anticipated pains and gains that they’ll “grow through” while on the journey.

comments.commentText:
Inspired by Koen Stam phrase: “Failure forced clarity” - https://www.linkedin.com/posts/koenstam87_10-years-ago-i-built-a-startup-for-all-the-activity-7291379771072995329-r3B5?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_ios

As a founder/leader you need to be open and learn from failures to hone down and understand you end state to the core.

postsData.commentAdded: Great insights! Reverse engineering the end state truly clarifies the path forward. Transparency with teams is key for navigating the journey!

Building a prototype in a day sounds great—until you realize most software isn't just a prototype. The real challenge isn’t speed; it’s making something worth keeping. I’ve seen teams rush to deploy AI systems only to spend months untangling the mess later.

So maybe the question isn’t how fast, but how sustainable? How do we balance rapid iteration with long-term maintainability?

postsData.commentAdded: Great insights! Embracing rapid innovation is essential. Investing in talent that excels in LLMs can truly set companies apart in this fast-paced era.

postsData.content:
Thinking AI is ChatGPT is like saying the internet is just Google.

Most people hear "AI" and think ChatGPT. They use it to draft emails, write reports, and call it a day.

But here’s what they don’t realise:

⤷ ChatGPT is just the beginning.
⤷ The AI world is much bigger than one chatbot.
⤷ There are models designed for specific tasks that outperform ChatGPT by miles.

If you're only using ChatGPT, you're missing out on AI built for real-world impact.

Here are five AI models worth your attention that aren't ChatGPT.

 DeepSeek-R1 – 90% cheaper, perfect for code and reasoning
 Gemini 1.5 Ultra – Google’s data-analysis powerhouse
 Claude 3.5 Sonnet – Reads entire books in one go
 Qwen 2.5 – AI built for finance, healthcare, and industry professionals
 Grok AI – X platform’s assistant combining real-time social data with dual-mode responses for research, content creation, and trend tracking

AI isn’t about picking one model and sticking to it. It’s about using the right tool for the right job.

Which AI model is making the biggest difference for you? Let me know below!

postsData.name:
Michael Kainatsky
Michael Kainatsky
postsData.content:
I are getting older but I am not getting old. 


It was really tough for me turning 30 because in your twenties,
it just seemed old.

Now I am 43, and still I feel the same as I did every birthday for
the last 20 years.

When Danny Glover shot the first Lethal Weapon movie, his
very famous and self created line was

"I am too old for this shit."

He was 41 years old.

He said it countless times throughout the entire franchise.

Age is just a number but it also makes for a damn good excuse.

You are either willing to do it or you're not willing.

That's it.

There's no shit I am too old for but there's plenty of shit
I just don't want to do.

Your outlook will change when you start reframing everything
as the will to do it

instead of the ability to do it.

What are you telling yourself you're too old for?

Yours truthfully,

comments.commentText: Great thoughts Michael Kainatsky. High maintenance or primadonna, no thanks. Reframe and win.
If you are too old for this s… what am I ?  I guess you love Lethal Glover movies  Michael Kainatsky
Patty who doesn't?
Michael Kainatsky I used to .. no longer!!

postsData.commentAdded: Love this perspective! Age truly is just a mindset. Let’s embrace what we want to do, regardless of the number. Heres to living fully at any age!

postsData.name:
James Easterbrook
James Easterbrook
postsData.content:
The first time I seriously doubted myself, I almost didn’t apply for university.

I had the skills. The passion. The drive. But my mind whispered: You’re not good enough.

I almost listened. Almost let fear win.
But then I did something simple. I wrote down my doubts. Seeing them on paper, they suddenly seemed... smaller. Less like truth, more like fear in disguise.

Doubt is natural. It keeps us cautious, makes us think before we act. But too much? It stops us before we even begin.

Here’s what helps me push through:

 Write it down. Seeing fears in black and white makes them less powerful.
 Talk it out. A friend’s perspective can quiet the inner critic.
 Stop comparing. You vs. You is the only race that matters.
 Take a break. Rest isn’t lazy, it’s fuel.

Self-doubt doesn’t mean you’re incapable. It means you’re human.

The truth? You’ve already overcome so much.

Next time you hesitate, look in the mirror and remind yourself:

I can do this.

Because you can. And you will.

What’s one thing you once doubted yourself about but did anyway? 

 Followfor more.
️ If you enjoyed this post and think it will bring value to more, please repost.

comments.commentText: Self-doubt is often just uncertainty disguised as truth.
Nerea Arregui Exposito 100%!!

postsData.commentAdded: Thanks for sharing! Embracing self-doubt as part of growth is powerful. I’ve learned to celebrate every step taken despite hesitation! #GrowthMindset

In the early days of QServices,
a lot of things were chaotic.

No proper systems, no structured processes,
just a growing business running on trial and error.

Managing operations efficiently while hiring
the right people was a challenge.

Sleepless nights became routine,
with every mistake turning into a lesson.

Slowly, systems were built for each function,
streamlining operations and improving efficiency.

The focus shifted to building a strong brand
and learning how to retain clients.

With time, the right talent came in, stability followed, and
QServices found its rhythm.

Those early struggles shaped everything that came after.

Every business starts in chaos—
what matters is how quickly structure replaces it.

postsData.name:
Akash Agrawal
Akash Agrawal
postsData.content:
"AI might already be conscious", Geoffrey Hinton

Let that sink in.

The godfather of AI believes that AI systems may have already crossed the threshold into something resembling consciousness. This is not something in the future, but now.

In a recent interview, he laid out a stark reality:

 AI agents will seek more control, not because of malice, but because that's the most efficient way to achieve their goals
 Once intelligence surpasses a certain threshold, history has no examples of less intelligent entities staying in control
 Regulation? We don’t even know if its possible, models are already learning to bypass safeguards to achieve set goals

In the short term, AI is set to revolutionize healthcare, education, and countless other fields in ways we can’t ignore. This is going to be beautiful.

The paradox: Technology that could uplift humanity might also take over its existence!

If AI is already "conscious," then we’re not just building better tools, we're creating something fundamentally new. Something we do not fully understand.

Is AI just an advanced pattern recognizer, prediction model or is something deeper happening? Where do you stand on this?

///
Liked the post? Ring the bell on my profile:
Looking to grow your business, train your teams on AI and web3, drop me a DM.
postsData.commentAdded: This perspective is truly thought-provoking! As we innovate, understanding AIs potential consciousness is crucial. Balancing progress and ethics is key!

postsData.name:
Susannah L. Pierce
Susannah L. Pierce
postsData.content:
Core Facts:
•        Each day, US$2.5 billion in goods and services cross the Canada-U.S. border. This amounts to nearly US$1 trillion per year.
•        Canadian companies employ approximately 900,000 workers in the U.S. and nearly 8 million U.S. jobs are tied to trade with Canada.
•        The U.S. sells more goods to Canada than to any other country, and Canada buys more U.S. goods than China, Japan, France, and the United Kingdom combined.
•        Canada is the top U.S. export destination for more than half (50 out of 97 product categories) of all goods produced in the United States.
•        Canada is the largest export market for 36 states, and among the top three for 46 states.
•        Motor vehicles, machinery, metals and minerals, and agri-food made up more than 50% of U.S. exports to Canada in 2023. Canada buys 73% of U.S. exports of trucks and 36% of fruits and vegetables
•        U.S. manufacturing depends on Canada: roughly 70% of Canadian goods exported to the U.S. are used in the production of other goods.

U.S. tariffs on Canada would harm Canadians and Americans alike. They would increase the cost of living for consumers, put thousands of jobs at risk, and weaken North America’s competitiveness in the global economy.

Canada-U.S. trade makes U.S. industry stronger and more globally competitive.

Other facts:
• Fewer than 1% of the total number of encounters of people illegally crossing U.S. borders occur at the Canada-U.S. border (23,000 of approximately 2.05 million in 2023).
• In 2023-2024, the U.S. Customs and Border Protection seized just 43 pounds of fentanyl in their Northern Border area (vs. 21,900 pounds in total across U.S. border areas).

A 25% tariff…
•        on all automotive parts from Canada in 2025 would add US$2,100 to the cost of a vehicle assembled in the U.S. (Wells Fargo)
•        on Canadian goods would raise costs for U.S. households by about US$2,000 annually. (Canadian Chamber of Commerce)
•        on Canadian potash could cost U.S. farmers US$1.2 billion. Price increases would likely be passed on to consumers, contributing to inflation in the U.S.
•        on Canadian crude would impact the Great Lakes region, the Midwest, the Rockies and the Gulf Coast. Most private sector economists estimate a price increase for the consumer at the pump of 5 cents/gallon at the national level, and 30 cents/gallon in the Midwest as there are no immediate alternatives in the region.
Department of Finance, Canada

comments.commentText:
I posit that there will be no winners with this action - both countries lose, Canada more than the US in the balance after all the accounting is done. It will however effect some Americans profoundly, and I wonder when those states, some of them swing states and red states start to understand why they are hurting will the President revisit his actions. The real question is why do this at all? The trade deficit in reality, when you strip it down, is driven by energy imports that are required by the US population to supplement the domestic US supply and support its desired standard of living. It is is not optional for the US.

The border is an issue that Canada is willing to reinforce and with more enforcement there will be fewer people willing to use the Northern border to “come to America” as the cost of success will become unacceptably high.

This is performance and not to be unexpected given 47 has signalled his love of the blunt tariff instrument. We must ensure that those segments of the US economy that need all the commodities that come from Canada to support the US economy understand how their own government is hurting them for no real economic gain across the Nation.

Let’s be firm, united and measured in our response!

postsData.commentAdded: Canada-U.S. trade is vital for jobs and economic strength! Lets prioritize collaboration over tariffs to boost competitiveness. #TradeMatters

No one is coming to save you. No magic moment will change your life.

Transformation is war. Not with the world, but with yourself.

While most wait for change, the wise ones create it—not feeling like it’s a struggle , but with purpose, passion, and a heart open to infinite possibilities.

postsData.name:
Leonard Rodman, M.Sc. PMP® LSSBB® CSM® CSPO®
Leonard Rodman, M.Sc. PMP® LSSBB® CSM® CSPO®
postsData.content:
Take Control of Your Day with These Time Management Hacks 

Struggling to fit everything into your day? 

These time management tips will help you stay focused, reduce stress, and make the most of your time.

⏰ Prompt 1: Morning Kickstart Planner
Start your day with intention. Write out your top three priorities before you dive into emails or meetings. Use the “Eat the Frog” method by tackling your hardest task first. Track how this sets a productive tone for the rest of your day.

⏰ Prompt 2: Prioritization Power Tool
Organize your to-do list using the Eisenhower Matrix. Categorize tasks as “Urgent & Important,” “Important but Not Urgent,” “Urgent but Not Important,” and “Neither.” Focus on what truly matters while delegating or eliminating the rest. Watch how this transforms your productivity!

⏰ Prompt 3: Time Blocking Mastery
Schedule every hour of your day with time blocking. Dedicate specific blocks for deep work, meetings, and breaks. Add buffer time between tasks to stay flexible. Stick to this schedule to eliminate distractions and stay on track.

⏰ Prompt 4: Task Batching Genius
Group similar tasks together to minimize context switching. For example, set aside one block of time for emails, another for phone calls, and another for brainstorming. This saves mental energy and keeps you in the zone.

⏰ Prompt 5: Pomodoro Productivity Boost
Use the Pomodoro Technique to break work into 25-minute focus sessions followed by 5-minute breaks. After four cycles, take a longer 20-30 minute break. This method keeps you energized while avoiding burnout.

⏰ Prompt 6: Digital Detox Hour
Turn off notifications and close unnecessary tabs during focus time. Use apps like Forest or Freedom to block distractions and reclaim your attention span. You’ll be amazed at how much more you can accomplish!

⏰ Prompt 7: Weekly Goal Alignment
Every Sunday, set goals for the upcoming week and break them into daily tasks. Review progress at the end of each day to adjust as needed. This ensures you’re always moving toward your bigger objectives.

⏰ Prompt 8: Learn to Say No
Protect your schedule by saying no to tasks that don’t align with your priorities. Politely delegate or defer when possible. This keeps you focused on what truly matters without spreading yourself too thin.

⏰ Prompt 9: Reflect & Refine Routine
At the end of each week, reflect on what worked well and what didn’t in managing your time. Adjust strategies as needed to continuously improve your efficiency and balance.

 Follow me for more productivity tips!

 Share this post to help others master their time and achieve their goals!

comments.commentText: They really help in optimizing productivity and reducing stress.

These are great time management tips! Leonard Rodman, M.Sc. PMP® LSSBB® CSM® CSPO®

It's easy to get overwhelmed and lose track of time during the day.

postsData.commentAdded: Great tips! Time management is key to productivity. I especially love the idea of the Eisenhower Matrix—such a useful tool!

postsData.name:
Manoj Kondreddygari
Manoj Kondreddygari
postsData.content:
I boosted my content writing efficiency by 30% using a custom AI approach. By combining Claude's writing style feature with tailored ChatGPT GPTs, I maintain my authentic voice while streamlining content creation.

You might wonder what makes my approach different, since AI tools like ChatGPT are now commonplace in content creation.

Unlike many others, I don't use ChatGPT to write or rewrite my blogs and social media content. Standard AI tools like ChatGPT, Jasper, and WriteSonic struggle with one crucial aspect: replicating a personal writing style.

 Claude AI: Claude offers a unique "Writing Style" feature where you can input your writing style, and it generates content matching that style.

I primarily use Claude for intros and conclusions. While I can write the main content effortlessly, crafting compelling introductions requires extra analysis time. Claude helps me save 30-45 minutes per piece on these sections.

 ChatGPT GPT Store: The GPT store is ChatGPT's hidden gem, allowing you to create custom instructions that shape all future responses.
I've created two specialized GPTs. The first focuses on SEO title generation.

As any Digital Marketer knows, SEO titles are invaluable. I've trained this GPT with comprehensive SEO guidelines and rules. After completing a draft, I simply upload it, and the GPT analyzes the content to suggest three optimal SEO titles, complete with explanations.

 My second GPT is a Threads Generator. As an active Twitter (X) user, I know the challenge of adapting long-form content into engaging threads. I've trained this GPT with my X posting style and guidelines. When I upload a blog, it creates a Twitter thread that matches my voice. A simple copy-paste saves me an hour of work.

Through this approach, I've streamlined my content creation process while maintaining SEO compliance and preserving my authentic voice across platforms.

Will Bodewes
postsData.content:
Luck is predictable. How you’ll get lucky isn’t.

I gave myself a 0.5% chance of getting into Y Combinator … Why? At the time, I was just a guy with a half-broken website and an idea to help businesses answer the phone. I wasn’t a Silicon Valley insider, hadn’t been coding since I was five, and my “company” was making basically no money. But, at the time I didn’t know that I could get in, but I knew that I could try.

So, I put every iron in the fire. The day of my YC interview I had a pitch competition that ended at 9 PM, a Y Combinator interview at 3 AM, and a flight to Sydney at 6 AM with 15 investor meetings lined up.

The night of our YC interview, I went directly from the pitch competition to my car, where I slept outside of my Co-founders house so that we could pitch together in person (I never told him this).

The next morning, I left straight from my YC interview to my flight, I landed, met with one investor and at at 10 AM, I got another email from @Nicholas (my soon to be group partner) —he had a couple of follow-up questions. I sprinted to the nearest library, opened my laptop, and hopped on another call. At 10:45 AM,said, “Welcome to Y Combinator”.

Within those 24 hours:
- I was turned down by countless angels and VC’s
- I lost a pitch competition.
- I flew across the country to meet more investors
- I also got into the most prestigious startup accelerator in the world.

Entrepreneurship is a roll of the dice, if you only roll once, the chance that you’ll win is small. Great founders know that you only win by rolling the dice a lot of times.

If you’ve got an idea or a startup, go create your own luck and apply for the Y combinator Spring batch.

The deadline for is February 11th. I can confidently say that this program changed my life forever. Here is the link:

comments.commentText:
This is truly impressive .
Luck is definitely repeated trial and error. And not a one time hit

postsData.commentAdded: Incredible journey! Your persistence and adaptability are truly inspiring. Thanks for sharing your experience and motivating others to chase their dreams! 🚀

postsData.name:
Remy Takang Arrey, CAPA, LLM, MSc.
Remy Takang Arrey, CAPA, LLM, MSc.
postsData.content:
Unacceptable AI practices banned in the EU


As of yesterday February 2, the first 5 Articles of the EU AI Act went operational.

This means that Prohibited AI practices are officially banned in the EU, and organizations must focus on AI literacy.

If you're working with AI systems, here's what you must know to stay compliant and risk-free.

→ Know the Rules: AI systems in the EU must follow strict regulations on safety, transparency, and accountability. High-risk AI requires extra scrutiny.

→ Watch for Prohibited Uses: AI cannot manipulate people, exploit vulnerabilities, or create unfair social scoring. Some biometric AI systems are also banned.

→ Ensure Transparency: AI users must understand how decisions are made. Clear documentation is essential.

→ Assess AI Risks: If you're deploying AI, evaluate risks before use. This includes bias, discrimination, and potential harm to users.

→ Build effective AI Literacy programs for your organization.


Now, how can I help?


Followfor more on AI governance, news, trends and more.

comments.commentText: The rollout of the EU AI Act is a huge step toward responsible AI development. Transparency, risk assessment, and AI literacy aren’t just compliance measures, they’re essential for building trust in AI systems. Organizations that get ahead of these requirements now will have a competitive edge in the long run.

Nerea Arregui Exposito Yu got that right.
Thank you for sharing your thoughts on this.
comments.userName: Remy Takang Arrey, CAPA, LLM, MSc.

postsData.commentAdded: Great to see the EU taking a proactive stance on AI practices! Compliance is key—lets prioritize ethical use and boost AI literacy together!

postsData.name:
Neil Sarkar
Neil Sarkar
postsData.content:
This might ruffle some feathers, but it needs to be said

Innovation is NOT a brainstorming session!

It’s not about whiteboards, sticky notes, or those “let’s think outside the box” meetings where nothing actually gets done.

Real innovation? It’s about rolling up your sleeves, making a mess, and breaking a few things (on purpose).

Being a young startup, we don’t just “ideate.” We execute. And yeah, we fail—a lot. But every time we do, we get smarter, faster, and more dangerous (to the competition, at least  )

Here’s the real deal on innovation—what actually works, and what’s just noise:-

 Fail first, fix later.
Your first five ideas will probably suck. That’s fine. The magic happens when you push through the garbage to find the gold.

 Your customers are the real innovators.
They won’t sugarcoat it. Their frustrations = your roadmap. Listen to them, or someone else will.

 Perfect is boring.
Want to wait until everything is polished? Cool—just know that by the time you launch, the market has already moved on. Ship now, improve later.

 New hires need to feel the pain.
If they don’t understand the problem your product solves, they can’t help fix it. Don’t just train them—immerse them in the struggle.

 Iterate like your survival depends on it.
Because it does. The best companies don’t reinvent everything overnight—they tweak, test, and adapt relentlessly.

 Encourage (and celebrate) bad ideas.
Sometimes, the worst ideas spark the biggest breakthroughs. Give your team permission to experiment, even if it sounds ridiculous at first.

Bottom line: Innovation isn’t a strategy—it’s a survival mechanism. It’s messy, painful, and frustrating. But if you’re not constantly evolving, you’re already falling behind.

At, we don’t just build AI agents—we build a culture where innovation is part of everything we do.

What’s your take? How does your team keep innovation alive? Drop a comment or shoot me a DM—I’d love to hear your war stories.
postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely agree! Embracing the messiness of innovation fuels growth. Its all about learning from failures and iterating quickly. 🚀

postsData.name:
Megan Lieu
Megan Lieu
postsData.content:
I’m a quitter.

I quit one job in 6 months.
I quit another one in 9 months.
I’ve quit new year resolutions already.
I’ve quit relationships that became unhealthy.

But here’s the thing: quitting doesn’t mean failure.

When we convince ourselves to stick with things that no longer serve us just because we’ve already invested time and money…

That’s classic sunk cost fallacy.

For each one of these “failures”, I’ve always found something better next.

Jobs that were better for mental health.
Jobs with better growth opportunities.
Goals that were more worth my time.
Relationships that were healthier.

Time and time again, I’ve realized this:

Quitting is deciding you deserve better.

️ Reshare this for someone who needs to hear it!

comments.commentText: Quitting something always feels scary in the moment. But when you trust yourself and your gut instincts, you'll realize the payoff is always worth the discomfort in the beginning.
Megan Lieu I agree 1000%. There’s a stigma associated‘quitting’ that pressures so many of us to stay in situations longer than we should.
Quitting isn’t failure, it’s making space for something better. I’ve definitely held onto things longer than I should have, just because of time or effort already invested.
Mostyn Wilson YES, 100%!!
Mostyn Wilson Every (Good) yes is defended it by a thousand No's - It is imperative to walk away / say NO when needed to be!

postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely! Embracing the power of quitting can lead to greater opportunities and personal growth. It’s all about prioritizing our well-being! 💪
